verses.text: 警告不義的有錢人你們富有的人哪，應當為那將要臨到你們的災禍哭泣哀號。

words.note: Lit. 'not righteous'
Indicates address or exclamation.

verses.text: 你們的財物朽壞了，你們的衣服給蛀了，
你們的金銀生鏽，這鏽要成為控告你們的鐵證，又要像火一樣吞吃你們的肉。你們竟然在這末後的日子積聚財寶。

words.note: Lit. 'iron proof', indicating strength.

verses.text: 看哪，工人為你們收割莊稼，你們竟然剋扣他們的工資；那工資必為他們呼冤；收割者的呼聲，已經達到萬軍之主的耳中了。

words.note: Commonly used for salary deduction.
A divine title, 'Lord of myriad armies'.

verses.text: 你們在世上窮奢極侈，養肥了自己，竟不知屠宰的日子到了。

words.note: An idiom describing excessive extravagance.

verses.text: 你們把義人定罪殺害，但他並沒有反抗。

words.note: Indicates the direct object is moved before the verb.
Used for emphasis, often with negation.

verses.text: 忍耐的人有福了所以，弟兄們，你們應當忍耐，直到主來。看哪，農夫等待著地裡寶貴的出產，為它忍耐，直到獲得秋霖春雨。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
An exclamation, often used to draw attention.

words.definition: in the ground, in the field

words.note: Refers to the later rain in the agricultural cycle.
Refers to the early rain in the agricultural cycle.

verses.text: 你們也應當忍耐，堅定自己的心；因為主再來的日子近了。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 弟兄們，不要彼此抱怨，免得你們受審判。看哪，審判的主已經站在門前了。

words.note: An exclamation, often used to draw attention.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 弟兄們，你們應當效法奉主的名說話的先知，以他們為受苦忍耐的榜樣。

words.note: A formal term used for respectful action or authority.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 看哪，那些忍耐的人，我們稱他們是有福的；你們聽過約伯的忍耐，也看見了主賜給他的結局，知道主是滿有憐憫和仁慈的。

words.note: Used to draw attention, often at the start of a sentence.
Can be a verb 'to endure' or adjective 'patient'.
Literally 'have blessing'.
Indicates a past experience.
Resultative compound verb.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Common in biblical texts for God's attribute.
Often paired with '憐憫' in religious contexts.

verses.text: 我的弟兄們，最要緊的是不可起誓：不可指著天起誓，也不可指著地起誓，任何的誓都當禁絕。你們的話，是就說是，不是就說不是；免得你們落在審判之下。

words.note: Plural of 'brother', used for fellow believers.
Forms the superlative degree.
Expresses strong prohibition.
Verb-object compound, 'to take an oath'.
Used to indicate the object by which one swears.
Indicates totality or universality.
Indicates consequence or immediate action.
Can also be a verb 'to judge'.
A classical postposition often following a noun.

verses.text: 義人的祈禱大有功效你們中間有人受苦嗎？他就應該禱告。有人心情愉快嗎？他就應該歌頌。

words.note: Can also be a verb 'to pray'.
Verb-object compound, 'to receive suffering'.
Verb-object compound, 'to report a prayer'.
Verb-object compound.

verses.text: 你們中間有人患病嗎？他就應該請教會的長老來，讓他們奉主的名為他抹油祈禱。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'to suffer from illness'.
Refers to church elders.
Classical usage, meaning 'to obey' or 'to receive by decree'.
Verb-object compound, a religious ritual.

verses.text: 出於信心的祈禱，可以使病人康復，主必叫他起來；他若犯了罪，也必蒙赦免。

words.note: Indicates origin or cause.
A causative verb.
Expresses strong certainty or obligation.
Similar to '使' (shǐ) in causative function.
Verb-complement compound, indicates upward movement or beginning of an action.
Formal equivalent of '如果' (rúguǒ).
Indicates completion of an action.
In a biblical context, usually refers to 'sin' rather than 'crime'.
Often implies receiving a favor or being subjected to something.

verses.text: 所以你們應當彼此認罪，互相代求，這樣你們就可以痊愈。義人祈禱所發出的力量，是大有功效的。

words.note: Verb-object compound: to admit guilt.
Verb-object compound: to ask on behalf of.
Often used in medical contexts, here for spiritual/physical healing.
Forms a noun phrase from the following verb.
Used at the end of a sentence for emphasis or confirmation.

verses.text: 以利亞是與我們性情相同的人；他懇切祈求不要下雨，地上就三年零六個月沒有雨；

words.note: Used to connect a number with a smaller unit, like 'three years AND six months'.

words.definition: did not have, there was no

verses.text: 他又祈禱，天就下雨，地就生出土產來。

words.note: Indicates something coming into being or a result.

verses.text: 我的弟兄們，你們中間若有人被騙離開了真道，如果有人使他回頭，

words.note: Lit. 'younger and older brothers', meaning brethren.
Often refers to Christian doctrine or the way of truth.
Figuratively means to change one's ways, to repent.

verses.text: 你們應該知道，那使罪人從歧途上轉回的，就會拯救他的靈魂脫離死亡，也會遮蓋許多罪惡。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for going astray morally.
Indicates location or direction, here 'from the path'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one who...'
In a biblical context, often refers to forgiveness covering sins.
A more severe or collective term for sins/evils.
